heroHeadline1: ASECNA: Ensuring Safe & Efficient Skies Across 19 African Nations
heroSubheadline1: Providing seamless air navigation services to foster safety, collaboration, and sustainable development.
heroHeadline2: Connecting Africa: The Future of Air Navigation Safety
heroSubheadline2: Leveraging state-of-the-art technology for unparalleled airspace management.
heroSubheadline3: Harmonizing air traffic across West & Central Africa and the Indian Ocean.
introText: For over 60 years, ASECNA has been the cornerstone of air navigation safety and coordination for its 19 Member States spanning West Africa, Central Africa, and the Indian Ocean. We are committed to providing world-class air navigation services, ensuring the safety and efficiency of flights within one of the largest airspace blocks in the world.
serviceTextATM: Optimizing airspace for safe, efficient, and fluid air travel across our regions.
serviceTextCNS: State-of-the-art Communication, Navigation, and Surveillance systems.
serviceTextAIM: Providing timely, accurate data crucial for flight planning and operational safety.
serviceTextMET: Delivering critical weather intelligence essential for safe flight operations.
memberStatesText1: ASECNA proudly serves 19 Member States, creating a vast, unified airspace managed with world-class standards. Our collaborative approach ensures seamless air navigation across West Africa, Central Africa, and the Indian Ocean.
memberStatesText2: This extensive network underscores our commitment to regional integration and aviation safety.
mapPlaceholderText: Stylized SVG Map of ASECNA Region Here
update1Text: Mr. Zo'o Minto'o was elected by the ASECNA Committee of Ministers at its 74th extraordinary meeting held on September 27, 2024, in Dakar. This decision was formalized by the Board of Directors at its 154th meeting, which took place on November 25, 2024, in Brazzaville....
update2Text: The final acts of this historic accession were taken on December 28, 2023 by the Director General, Mr. Mohamed Moussa, and, respectively, the Minister of Foreign Affairs and the Minister of Infrastructure of Rwanda....
update3Text: Il est ouvert au titre de l'année académique 2025-2026 le concours d'entrée à l'École Africaine de la Météorologie et de l'Aviation....
ctaTitle: Ready to Take Flight with ASECNA?
ctaText: Explore career opportunities or get in touch to learn more about our services.
footerTextASECNA: Agency for the Safety of Air Navigation in Africa and Madagascar.
